result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus A Garcia Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: on or near Certain Places, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge

**Pursuant to the Court of Appeal decision in State v. Edward, 2015 WI 51, 363 Wis.2d 628 and State v. Radaj, 2015 WI 50, 363 Wis.2d 633, and 973.13, Stats., the JOC is amended to remove the DNA surcharge(s).  Government entities shall, to the extent legally obligated to do so, comply with the courts Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction Re: DNA Surcharge(s) entered herein.**

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random urinalyses or other drug testing, to occur at least once per month for the first year of the Probation term
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--contact with Samantha Krosnic is allowed, unless otherwise prohibited by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with Jacob Jeske or Christopher Denruiter
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent, and also excepted for incidental contact at employment or educational program 

Arresting Agency:  JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes: --To perform 100 hours of community service for a public agency or a non-profit chartiable organization

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF51. #14CF91, #14CF115 called at 11:10am. 
Defendant Jesus A Garcia Torres in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #4 of Case #14CF51 and Count #1 of Case #14CF91; factual basis stipulated;  the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Garcia Torres guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses the remaining counts in Case #14CF51 and Case #14CF91; and the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF115.

On Case #14CF51, Count #4 and Case #14CF91, Count #1 the Court withholds sentences, and places Mr. Garcia Torres on Probation for two years, with conditions:

--in Case #14CF91 only: to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on October 24, 2014 at 7:00pm. 
---Mr. Garcia Torres is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random urinalyses or other drug testing, to occur at least once per month for the first year of the Probation term
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--contact with Samantha Krosnic is allowed, unless otherwise prohibited by the Agent
--in Case #14CF51: to perform 100 hours of community service for a public agency or a non-profit chartiable organization
--in Case #14CF51: no direct or indirect contact with Jacob Jeske or Christopher Denruiter
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent, and also excepted for incidental contact at employment or educational program 
--in Case #14CF91:to comply with DNA sample provision 
--in Case #14CF91: to pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $50 drug testing fee, plus $120 drug buy-money (the drug testing fee and drug buy-money amounts include those from read-in Case #14CF115)
--in Case #14CF51, to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge, plus $125 drug testing fee

Days credit for time already served: 0  days
As to Case #14CF91 (only) the Court will allow expungement of the case if Mr. Garcia Torres successfully completes the Probation term; the Court clarifies to the Defense that Mr. Garcia Torres will need to petition for exungement at the time 
The Court will not allow expungement of case #14CF51.
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties recited
As to the DNA surcharge in Case #14CF51:  The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.
recess 11:32am
Final status/scheduling conference on September 29, 2014 at 11:00 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 11:06am.
Defendant Jesus A Garcia Torres in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for FSSC today and for Jury Trial next week, however Attorney De La Rosa requests adjournment.  Attorney De La Rosa explains that 
Mr. Garcia Torres has two other files pending, and the parties are working toward a global resolution of all three cases.
The Court removes the Jury Trial from next week's calendar.
Mr. Garcia Torres indicates that his Beach Street address remains current. 
recess 11:08am.

NEXT:  schedule case for Final Status/Scheduling Conference (intent is that a change of plea will occur) on 9/29/14 at 11:00am
Jury trial on September 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.

cases #14CF51, #14CF91 and #14CF115 called at 3:51pm. 
Defendant Jesus A Garcia Torres in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases are set for Plea & Sentencing hearing today, however Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the Defense is not ready to proceed. Attorney De La Rosa explains that the plea agreement is based on drug and alcohol testing that Mr. Garcia Torres was to have done, however because of financial struggles, Mr. Garcia Torress has not been able to have the test done.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the Defense is not proceeding to trial in these cases; Attorney De La Rosa needs to get together with DA Happ and work toward an agreement based on the circumstances are they are now.
The Court indicates that it is scheduling the case 
Mr. Torres verifies that the Beach Street address is current.
recess 3:54pm. 

NEXT:   schedule each case for FSSC and Jury Trial on separate dates in late September/early October; the cases are to be set in case number consecutive order
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

ADA Shock: No objection
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Garcia Torres

.

Mr. Garcia Torres waives his right to Preliminary Hearing in each case; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.

ADA Hall files the Information only in cases #14CF51.  

In case #14 CF 91 ,the Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond with conditions:

--no possession of drug paraphernalia  
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

In case #14 CF115 ,the Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond with conditions:   
--no direct or indirect contact with Jacob Jeske
--no possession or consumption of alcohol

--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia  
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no
 acts or threats of violence
